ShadowQuest

Class Villager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShadowQuest.GameObject
      • ShadowQuest.Unit
        • ShadowQuest.Villager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Healer, Peasant, Prince

    public abstract class Villager
extends Unit
    Villagers are friendly units who help the player. The player can interact with villagers if they are close enough, prompting some dialogue from the villager, and some event to occur. Villagers cannot move, attack, or be attacked.
    Author:
    Adrian Cheung

      • Villager

        public Villager(Position pos,
                Stats stats,
                java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String ref)
         throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Constructor to make a new Villager object.
        Parameters:
        pos: - Position on the map which the unit spawns at
        stats: - The base stats the unit has when it is created
        name: - Unit's name
        ref: - Folder location of image used when rendering the unit
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - General exception thrown by Slick library classes

      • renderDialogue

        public void renderDialogue(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                           Camera camera)
        Render the relevant dialogue on the screen. Text is rendered slightly above the villager's label.
        Parameters:
        g: - Slick graphics object, used for drawing
        camera: - Camera used for displaying the world

      • renderVillager

        public void renderVillager(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                           Camera camera)
                    throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Render the villager image itself, then render the villager's label Next, render the villager's dialogue appropriately depending on the context if the villager was interacted with recently.
        Parameters:
        g: - Slick graphics object, used for drawing
        camera: - Camera, displays the game world
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - General exception thrown by Slick library classes

      • sayNext

        public abstract void sayNext(Unit target)
        Determine the dialogue the villager should say, depending on the context of the interaction. Could also depend on the target
        Parameters:
        target: - Unit which the dialogue is directed to

      • interact

        public abstract void interact(Unit target)
        Villager performs some action, depending on the villager type and the context of the interaction. Could also depend on the target
        Parameters:
        target: - Unit which the villager is interacting with
